channel.title: Terms of services
channel.description:
hi, i'm new and was just wondering, who and how do you make your disclaimer/terms of services at the welcome screen to the forums please? Is it possible for me to use it too? (though not in it's exact form, as it isn't the same sort of forum.) It's just I've got a forum that users may potentially post keygens and other programs/cheats etc for games that may shut us down if the information was taken the wrong way or found to be used for illegal activity.
What I'm really asking is, how would I start to make a decent disclaimer that won't get me into trouble please? Also, can I use MITB's disclaimer as a template :confused:

item.title: Terms of services
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

[quote=“PainAngel, post:10, topic:15619”][quote author=Ron link=topic=23328.msg261990#msg261990 date=1158886139]
[php]
// If cookie not found, display tos.
if(!cookie) {
echo “blah blah tos blah blah type yes to go”;
}
// If the lowercase of whatever was entered in the input box on the tos page equals yes
// then go to the page at whatever the redirect is in the url.
// moparisthebest.com/smf/?redirect=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/php
if (Lowercase($_POST[‘TOS’]) = ‘yes’) {
header: $_GET[‘redirect’];
}
[/php]
[/quote]
that can’t be the entire php code can it?[/quote]

i thought you knew php yourself?

anyways, it’s full of errors as there is no lowercase function, cookie on it own cant be the $_COOKIE[] superglobal, and for header redircts it would be like [php]<?php header(“Location: $_GET[‘redirect’]”);[/php]

edit: also, he’s forcing the TOS form value to be yes

Read full topic

item.title: Terms of services
item.dc:creator: @PainAngel PainAngel
item.description:
@PainAngel wrote:

[quote author=Ron link=topic=23328.msg261990#msg261990 date=1158886139]
[php]
// If cookie not found, display tos.
if(!cookie) {
echo “blah blah tos blah blah type yes to go”;
}
// If the lowercase of whatever was entered in the input box on the tos page equals yes
// then go to the page at whatever the redirect is in the url.
// moparisthebest.com/smf/?redirect=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/php
if (Lowercase($_POST[‘TOS’]) = ‘yes’) {
header: $_GET[‘redirect’];
}
[/php]

that can’t be the entire php code can it?

Read full topic

item.title: Terms of services
item.dc:creator: @Nerice Nerice
item.description:
@Nerice wrote:

If its illegal or against your hosts TOS nothing you say will protect you. You cant change the law by saying it doesnt apply on your site…

Read full topic

item.title: Terms of services
item.dc:creator: @PainAngel PainAngel
item.description:
@PainAngel wrote:

yea i know php, i know that, i meant what sort of content do i put in the disclaimer, cos i really don’t want people to find loopholes etc.
the actual text in the disclaimer, can i use that please?

Read full topic

item.title: Terms of services
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

[php]
// If cookie not found, display tos.
if(!cookie) {
echo “blah blah tos blah blah type yes to go”;
}
// If the lowercase of whatever was entered in the input box on the tos page equals yes
// then go to the page at whatever the redirect is in the url.
// moparisthebest.com/smf/?redirect=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/php
if (Lowercase($_POST[‘TOS’]) = ‘yes’) {
header: $_GET[‘redirect’];
}
[/php]
